column2: title=<small>J.R.R. Tolkien: ''The Hobbit'': Drawings, Watercolors and Manuscripts, June 11 - September 30, 1987</small>

column1: '''''J.R.R. Tolkien:''''' '''The Hobbit:''' '''''Drawings, Watercolors and Manuscripts''''' is an exhibition catalogue which reproduces a variety of illustrations by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] for ''[[The Hobbit]]'' - both finished pieces and sketches. Less well known items include the original draft of the dustwrapper artwork and a manuscript page showing a "Map of the Upper River and Mirkwood".

Also includes a letter to G.E. Selby and two essays:  'J.R.R. Tolkien: Pictures Fit for an Exhibition' by Curtis L. Carter and 'The Expectant Landscape: J.R.R. Tolkien's Illustrations for The Hobbit' by Richard Schindler.<ref>''An Illustrated Tolkien Bibliography'', at Tolkienbooks.net</ref>
